content: That is an indication that it is the wrong password. If that password works when logging in online in browser, that is an indication that your email provider requires a separate password for email clients.
creator: davidsk

content: Open your profile folder, Quit Thunderbird then delete the session.json file from the profile folder. This file is where information about opened tabs is stored, so that they can reopen when Thunderbird starts, so delete it so that Thunderbird "forgets" about those many tabs you accidentally opened. For more information about your Thunderbird profile, see Profiles - Where Thunderbird stores your messages and other user data
creator: stancestans

content: Bug reports should be directed to Mozilla's Bugzilla instance so the developers can track the issue. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org

content:
Hi, If you have server side filters for some reason, the messages could be moved to different folders than your Inbox before arriving to your Thunderbird client. this checkbox ensures that the folder specified will be always checked for new content.

I hope that helps!

content: THere is one safe procedure: - exit thunderbird on old pc - copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to an external drive - create thunderbird on new setup and exit - copy the exported thunderbird profile to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overwrite the default thunderbird folder that was created in setup - restart thunderbird
creator: davidsk

content: This might be an incorrect password or incorrect server setting. I think microsoft accounts need app password. It may help to also post screenshot of server settings.

content: This is indicative of an incorrect password. Most (all?) Microsoft-related email accounts now require separate app passwords.
creator: davidsk

content: go to tools>addons and see if you have a dark theme applied. Also check to see if you have any extension addons that set dark mode. These are the usual two areas for dark mode. A final place to check would be if you have CSS statements in a userControl.css file stored in a folder named chrome in your profile.
creator: davidsk
